article_title: Matthew Slaughter: 'High-Trade' Jobs Pay Higher Wages
article_text:
The government's employment report for December showed that the central policy challenge is not just more jobs but rather more well-paying jobs. About a third of the 2.2 million new jobs in 2013 were in retail, accommodation and food services, two of the lowest-paying industries. Only 3.5% of the new jobs last year were in higher-wage manufacturing industries.

There is a growing concern about stagnant or falling incomes, yet most of the measures proposed to deal with the issue—raising the minimum wage and reinstating...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Matthew Slaughter writes that workers in multinational firms earn more, as global engagement fosters innovation and productivity growth.
